199
Chest medicine
Fig 4.19 AP chest radiograph showing air-space shadowing in the left upper zone. Although this 
appearance often represents infection, it is non-speciﬁ c. Diff erential diagnosis for this distribution 
of shadowing include lymphoma, alveolar cell carcinoma (both to be considered if not resolving in 
appearance on follow-up imaging), and haemorrhage.
Image courtesy of Nottingham University Hospitals NHS Trust Radiology Department.
